item.title: Forward Equipment Cooling Overboard Exhaust Valve – Valve Inoperative SMOKE Position

remarks.para: May be inoperative in SMOKE (partially open) position provided:

numlitem.para: Aircraft remains at or below FL350, and

For passenger, combi, STCs ST01529SE, ST01920LA, and ST03562AT freighters, procedures are established and used to ensure lower aft cargo compartment remains empty or is verified to contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), and/or Fly Away Kits.

note.para: UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

operation.para: If valve is in SMOKE (partially open) position:

placard.para: Placard near the Equip Cooling switch "OVERBOARD EXHAUST VALVE INOP-SMOKE OPEN" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: If the position of the (butterfly-type) airfoil disk, within the valve body, has not been visually confirmed to be fixed open or missing, the following procedure must be performed:
Place equipment cooling switch to the ALTN position.
Open forward cargo compartment left sidewall panel four feet aft of forward bulkhead. Ensure valve actuator position indicator is in the SMOKE position.
Disconnect and stow the electrical connector from the Forward Equipment Cooling Overboard Exhaust Valve.
Deselect the ALTN equipment cooling mode.
Press RECIRC FAN switch to ON.
